title: Cabrillo National Monument: News Releases
body: News Releases           Subscribe  | What is RSS     May 31, 2016  Celebrating Biodiversity at San Diego’s Urban Island  On May 21st, 2016 Cabrillo National Monument along with over 119 park service units, proudly provided a platform for the San Diego community to get involved in citizen science through the 2016 National Parks Centennial Bioblitz.   February 24, 2016  Andrea Compton Selected as Superintendent for Cabrillo  SAN FRANCISCO – The National Park Service has selected Andrea Compton to be the next superintendent of Cabrillo National Monument in San Diego.   December 18, 2015  Cabrillo National Monument Will Increase Entrance Fees Beginning January 5  Starting on January 5, 2016, Cabrillo National Monument (NM) will increase entrance fees for visitors in order to fund important maintenance and improvement projects within the park.   September 03, 2015  All 4th Grade Students Visit Free!  Cabrillo National Monument invites all 4th grade students to visit the park for free as part of the White House’s new Every Kid in a Park program. Starting September 2nd, 4th grade students can now go to www.everykidinapark.gov to complete an activity and obtain a free annual entry pass to more than 2,000 federal recreation areas, including national parks.   April 02, 2015  National Park Week 2015  Encourages Everyone To Find Your Park  San Diego, CA – Cabrillo National Monument (NM) joins parks, programs and partners across the country to encourage everyone to find their park and share their stories online at FindYourPark.com.
